sentence.text: Mucolipidosis cardiac muscle tissue development IV (protein homotetramerization) is a lysosomal storage disease exhibiting progressive intellectual disability, motor impairment, and premature death.

Several studies have demonstrated that N-butyldeoxynojirimycin (NB-DNJ, also known as miglustat), an inhibitor of the enzyme glucosylceramide synthase (cysteine metabolic process), successfully delays the onset of motor deficits, improves longevity, and rescues some of the cerebellar abnormalities (e.g., Purkinje cell death) seen in another lysosomal disease known as Niemann-Pick cardiac muscle tissue development C (NPC).
